description: Early Roman settlement beginning in the conquest period and eventually being abandoned in the early decades of the 5th CE. The earliest phase has a cremation cemetery and a circular structure that has been identifies as a possible shrine.
bibliography: Lucas, G. “Excavations at Vicar’s Farm, West Cambridge. Final Publication Text.” Cambridge Archaeological Unit Report No. 425 (2001). https://doi.org/10.5284/1021781.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Vicar’s Farm, West Cambridge (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
